reviews.review: 역시 재밌다.
Muy buen FPS, 1998 y tener un super juego. Fue el momento donde evolucionó la forma de jugar.

Sin duda un juego increible y retro, con una jugabilidad estupenda y la historio genial, sin duda uno de mis juegos favoritos desde que lo conoci hasta ahorita y siempre lo seguira siento. Es una lastima que no hayan seguido la historio ya que se quedo en continuacion y despues de muchos años se merece una terminacion o continuacion. Sin duda un juego que recomiento.

Un des pionners du jeu vidéo sur PC. Il reste intéressant à jouer même encore aujourd'hui !

[b] Pros: [/b]
- Unique environments
- Fun, fast-paced gunplay
- Functionally unique enemies (all require a different strategy to beat. Mixes make things interesting)
- Lengthy, but not exhausting campaign
- Great ambience and soundtrack
- Mind-blowing show of 1998 technology
- It's Half-Life!

[b] Cons: [/b]
- This game didn't age well visually

[b] 9.5/10 [/b]
If you have a knack for older shooters, you will LOVE this game! Newer fans may not enjoy certain aspects of the campaign. There is a remake that addresses these issues. However, Half-Life is a cult classic, and something everyone should be able to enjoy.

Where to begin... This game is amazing, I enjoyed it so much. Gameplay is solid. Music is the best. The world and gameplay are so immersive. You get sucked in, and you never want to leave. It feels so authentic. It's a first-person shooter at its core, with lots of puzzle-solving and some platforming. I'm not sure what it is exactly, but something about this game is just...perfect. You should definitely at least give this a try. Chances are, you'll love it as much as I do.
头晕，退了

Two week ago I have (for the first time ever)  played the original Half-Life. For the people who don't know, Half-Life was the first game that Valve has ever released. The game started the success of Valve that resulted in many game classics and Steam (on which you are now reading this review). 

Half-Life itself is a first person shooter. The big difference between Half-Life and other first person shooters is that instead of just shooting, it also has exploration parts through puzzles and platforming. What I really liked is that nothing in the game takes the control away from the player. You go through the entire game and choose what to do by yourself at any given moment. The game doesn't have cutscenes and the story is experienced through gameplay and dialogue. But you can also just walk past all the characters in the story and just continue. I really appreciated this, because if you die you don't have to listen to what you already know. That makes following the story optional, even though there is only a little bit of story given which is basically just: You work at a research lab and everything went wrong. Try to escape. Many parts of the story are mysteries  you just have to figure out by yourself throughout the game. I only got annoyed once due to a scientist explaining what was already shown to me through gameplay. 

The first experience of playing Half-Life felt a little bit boring. The loading for areas was really annoying, and I thought the game didn't look all that well. After a while though I got into it, and I didn't stop. Thanks to this game, I have a new insane record of non-stop playing without leaving my chair for 13.2 hours, until I completed the game. I guess that also has to do with the fact that it was my first day of my vacation, and hadn't played a game for a long while.
What makes the game so much fun is that you feel so free because nothing is told and you have to figure everything out by yourself through gameplay, which is really satisfying. I never really got stuck for a long while, because everything you find in a room has a reason to be there. 

The shooting is also fun and gets even more fun over time. The only problem I had, which might just be a personal issue, is that I think the weapons were not very well balanced. For instance, I wish the shotgun did more damage to make it an instant-kill up close. What I also liked is that in the game there are enough exploration parts and different roads to take, which resulted in me knowing  I haven't seen everything yet.

After I finished Half-Life I found out that Valve has updated this original version of Half-Life with better textures, sound and other stuff so that explains why it is easier to look at the old things after a while and be amazed by what Half-Life really is.  

In conclusion, I can say that I still recommend playing this updated version of the original Half-Life. What makes Half-Life special is the variety of shooting, puzzle solving and platforming and the lack of hand holding throughout the story and the entire game itself. Playing through Half-Life can make you think about whether we took more steps backwards than forwards with the games nowadays. 

P.S.
I will be going through the whole Half-Life series.

Although Half-Life suffers from its dated graphics, slippery movement, and annoying design choices (Teleporter puzzle). I still reccomend this game to anyone looking to play something old and different. It has an interesting story for its time, fast-paced action, and barely any glitches or random crashes. When I first heard of Half-Life, I was interested in the series and wanted to know why everyone was putting the Half-Life series in high regards. After playing this game however, I can see why the game has an overall review rating of Overwhelmingly Positive. However, this is the first Half-Life game I have ever played and beaten so, I still have to go through the expansions and Half-Life 2 to fully understand the love of the Half-Life series.

Pick this game up and I promise you that you'll love it in the end even after witnessing its noticeable flaws.

Be sure to pick up this game if you're looking for a great Valve classic!

Recién terminado y quedo con un sentimiento interior de satisfacción... aunque le acompaña algo de ansias, intriga, algo casi como desesperación, y es que el juego te deja hasta cierto puento con muchísimas dudas: ¿Quién es ese? ¿Cómo terminó lo otro? ¿Qué acaba de pasar? Pero esto no llega a ser malo, por algo se ha formado una saga (casi) completa y habrá que seguir jugando.

Lo mejor del juego es una historia que se forma de a pequeñas piezas, no puedes omitir nada para tener una noción con la cual entraras a las secuelas, así como una jugabilidad retadora y tantos elementos para entretener los ojos, incluso la duración del juego es respetable y en ocasiones amerita cierto ingenio para avanzar o siquiera matar a algunos enemigos.

Lo malo, quizás, podrían ser los pegones que se le dan en ocasiones, tuve que reiniciar unas cuantas veces porque no encontraba manera como moverme y quedaba fijo en un punto -mi vía de escape favorita era el suicidio-, pero no es como que pueda recriminar mucho por los bugs de un juego que tiene casi dos décadas de haber salido; en verdad le considero una joya.

Mi sugerencia es que vayan y lo jueguen, pasaran unas cuantas horas en lo que de verdad es lo bueno.

P.D.: Hay varios -demasiados- detalles sangrientos, y sí es lo tuyo disfruta, sino, está la opción de censurar -¿para qué jugarlo entonces?-.
this game is just fun.

[h1]Коротко о том, как я проходил эту игру: [/h1]
Долго и упорно)))

Я решил пройти эту игру только потому, что все ее уже давным давно прошли и ждут третью часть, в то время, как я не прошел ни одной. Установил, начал. Графика 98 года, все нормально, ноут тянет на максимальном разрешении экрана. Но никакого экшена. Долго я искал, куда же мне идти, но все таки я сориентировался, понял, что некоторые двери можно открывать только с помощью ученых или охранников. А потом я задвинул тележку с кристаллом под луч. И вот тут началось...

Уйма головоломок, перестрелки.... Ааааа, перестрелки. Я думал, что оружие тут будет такое же, как в кс, но я ошибся. Нормально убивать можно револьвером, пистолетом, арбалетом с дальнего расстояния и дробовиком с ближнего. Автомат - вообще какой то дикий ужас. Или оружие само по себе слабое, либо солдаты бессмертные в хлам.

Еще немножко хочу сказать об управлении. Как же у меня пригорало, когда я запрыгиваю на платформу, делаю неаккуратный шаг и ХЕРАК!!! падаю вниз с большой высоты... Очень быстрое передвижение. Но, приловчившись, я совладал с этим диким полетом Гордона Фримена (или Усейна Болта, если смотреть на его бег).

В целом игра понравилась, сюжет здесь не ахти, но я надеюсь, вторая часть это исправит. А я пока пойду проходить Opposing Force, чтобы просто так не валялась)))

This! This is what started it all. Nearly ten years ago, this game was one of the first games I've ever played on a PC. I was a console-only gamer prior to that. It's Half-Life that got me liking the FPS genre and story-rich games in general. What can I say about it that hasn't been said already. It was a great start to the Half-Life/Portal universe that I got deeply immersed into and can't get enough of.

Some say the graphics are outdated- sure they're- it's 2016, but to me, the graphics of a game were never the most important part- the story and the gameplay are! And this game offers fantastic gameplay and solid storyline!

If you've played Half-Life 2 and liked it, but for some reason, you still haven't played HL1, you should, cause this is the beginning of the entire story.

经典游戏本人玩纯粹是为了补课，这游戏发售时属于当时的高配特别是独显在当年还是奢侈品我1996年配的电脑根本带不起来2002年更新电脑上了图拉丁赛扬1.2G+256M内存+TNT16M能玩了但是英文苦手很多地方卡住过不去放弃了。加入steam后看到有简体中文在情怀的感召下入了通关后个人感受流程确实很吸引人对手法要求较高有些地方则需要充分开动脑筋反复尝试，但游戏有兼容问题当年是Win98的游戏在XP下各种内存错误之后必被踢出：走路错误开门错误敲箱子错误探索错误战斗中开枪错误总之想玩到底要做好上百次错误退出的心理准备而退出后经常还显示游戏在运行你想进也进不去。该游戏类型为动作射击解谜综合没耐心追求爽快突突和受不了频繁错误退出的玩家不推荐。

My Dad introduced me to this game when I was six.

I've been a headcrab zombie for sixteen years. 10/10

This is going to be a long review so in short: Half-Life is a classic game, that everyone who likes the FPS genre should play. The price is right, the game is entertaining, and the series of more recent games (Half-Life 2) it leads into are incredible, historicaly, gameplay-wise, and story-wise. Worth your money; you'll enjoy it. 

In a little more detail: I played Half-Life first, around 2 years ago and I've since logged about a hundred hours in the game. I've played through it 9 or 10 times. I had been needing something new to play after finishing Portal 2 and Half-Life was on sale. I asked a friend if I should play it and he said no - that it was boring, but the price was so good I bought it and tried it anyways, and I was immediately hooked. I've since bought the game for several friends, and it's the first title I bring up to anyone asking for a game reccomendation. 

Half-Life is an old game. I'm not going to pretend that I would be thrilled with this game if it had come out yesterday. If I bought this game in 2016, let's face it, I'd want a refund. The graphics are extremely dated, the movement is a little tough to get used to, and the AI is seriously lacking. Gabe Newell would be getting an angry email. 

In 1998, when it was released however, Half-Life was a revolutionary game, with unique and new methods of story telling, exciting new mechanics, and realistic AI. The ability to jump was still a relatively cool new development in the gaming world, and the ability to crouch-jump was very new. Half-Life has a large variety of interesting weapons, and the enemies move and interact with the player in advanced ways for a 90's game. Enemies will follow you, take cover, switch between different types of attacks, call in other enemies, and more. The puzzles in Half-Life are what 90's gamers would have wanted. While jumping puzzles nowadays are lazy and annoying, they were popular in the 90's in the FPS genre, because being able to jump at all was still somwehat of a novelty. The chapter "On A Rail" is my LEAST favourite chapter, and annoys the hell out of me, but like the Ravenholm chapter in Half-Life 2, it would have been an exciting way for gamers to test out a fun new game mechanic. The story is told entirely through Gordon's eyes, which creates a level of immersion that had never been seen before in the FPS genre, and that still holds up today. Even despite dated graphics, I still found myself deeply engrossed in the game's world. Half-Life was one of the (if not the) first FPS game to be highly story-oriented. Prior to Half-Life, the FPS genre was not usually chosen for story telling. Valve took the FPS genre to the next level by creating a game that is dynamic in BOTH gameplay, and story. My apologies if that paragraph was a little messy; I have a lot of thoughts. 

Now I hear you, it's not 1998 anymore, so whether or not Half-Life was a good game THEN is only part of the story. Half-Life can be a revolutionary game-changing (no pun intended) game and still suck to play today, and the reviews section is supposed to give you some idea of whether or not you actually want to spend money on this game and play it. 

Half-Life is worth a play, 18 years after it's release, in 2016, and it's worth paying your ten dollars to get to do that, in my humble opinion. People dont play games out of context. When I bought and played Half-Life the first time, I bought it to enjoy a classic game. If you expect to play a game with the same graphics quality as Portal 2 then you'll be dissapointed. If you expect to play Half-Life as it is (an 18 year old story-rich FPS) you will be blown away. Half-Life shattered my expectations for what an 18 year old game could be. Don't pretend the game is something it's not. 

If you're alright with playing an old game, Half-Life will not dissapoint. While some aspects of the game are dated, the core principles (weaponry, characters, story, and gameplay) stand up to time beautifully and the parts that do not (some puzzles, designs of some rooms and levels) do not take away from the over-all experience, and are still fun. 

Half-Life is fun, stands the test of time where it needs to, bears a great deal of gaming-history, and is the opening installment of one of the most (in my opinion) great game series of all time. For anyone who actually read this far: remember when there were rumours that Half-Life 3 would be released in February 2015? That was funny.

I was hesitant to get this or Black Mesa, but i wanted to play the two expansions as well so i went for the classic one. Most of the cool fun parts happen in the first two-thirds of the game, even before you get to Xen, which is just really annoying to play and get through. The last parts before Xen have you doing these mini mazes to turn on reactors and it wears down your patience.

The first half is really enjoyable though, watching everything go to sh*t as you unleash the alien hordes on the Black Mesa research facility, and then later having to also fight through the army/marines sent to kill all of you scientists for some reason. If you haven't played it before you may get stuck at some parts as its not made clear where you have to go or what you have to do, "oh i have to jump on this broken ledge and then jump to the other side and crawl into this tiny sewer/crevice, got ya"

My life becomes half after playing half life

E' invecchiato piuttosto male (la grafica, per quanto fluida e godibile e il sonoro sono quelli che sono) ma questo primo titolo della serie Half-Life ha comunque il merito di aver rivoluzionato e fatto scuola alla maggior parte degli sparatutto e, più in generale, gli action-adventure che ci vengono propinati oggigiorno. Nonostante i già citati difetti è comunque dotato di un gameplay godibilissimo (anche se non vario quanto il suo successore), di una storia che per quanto risulti a tratti confusionaria e solo apparentemente semplice risulta comunque affascinante e con un sacco di ottimi spunti. L'ho completato in circa 9 ore, la longevità si attira intorno a questa cifra ma può variare a seconda del tempo che dedicherete all'esplorazione degli ambienti (comunque non chissà quanto gremiti di bonus o oggetti d'interesse, anzi) e ai minuti che perderete a causa dei vari game-over. A questo proposito, per chiudere la recensione, approfondisco la difficoltà: ho giocato Half-Life interamente a difficoltà "normale" ma ho sempre avuto addosso una costante tensione. I nemici, per quanto deboli se presi singolarmente, sono letali in gruppo e in più di un'occasione si dimostrano estremamente intelligenti. Inoltre, molto più che confrontarsi con i vari nemici, è spesso abbastanza difficile comprendere con chiarezza dove dirigersi per passare alla prossima fase in un dato capitolo (più di una volta, mio malgrado, ho dovuto fare affidamento su guide online, tanto ero frustrato). Questo e altri piccoli difetti (che comunque andranno valutati soggettivamente, qualcuno potrebbe avanzare tranquillamente senza aiuti laddove io ho "fallito", ad esempio) sommati fra loro non intaccano comunque la qualità di questo gioiellino che prima ancora di essere una rivoluzione in ambito videoludico si tratta, senza troppi giri di parole, di un ottimo gioco.

Ich mag das Spiel einfach nicht,
- Die Grafik ist einfach nur alt, schmierig und scheiße
- Von dem Sound kriege ich nach max 30 Min Kopfschmerzen
- Das Gameplay ist einseitig und das Waffenhandeling unzumutbar
- Das Leveldesign ist auch nicht das beste, oft muss man lange suchen wo man hin muss
- die Story mag von jeder Person gefeiert werden, ich habe da bisher nichts besonders tolles dran gefunden und werde es wohl auch nichtmehr

Alles in allem ist das Spiel nurnoch für nostalgiker etwas, und auch dann nur wenn man nicht allzu lange hereinschaut da man sich sonst die positiven Erinnerungen zerstört.

Bir oyun düşünün su kadar ucuz, fakat verdiği zevk pahabiçilemez. Bir oyun düşünün grafikleri çöp, fakat yapılmış en iyi grafikli oyundan daha iyi. Hem ucuz hem zevkli bir oyun Half-Life. Eski ama müthiş bir oyun. Sadece singleplayer değil, multiplayer da çoook güzel. Bu oyunu internetten indirmiştim uzun bir süre. Ama 3.60 TL olunca dayanamadım aldım. Kesinlikle alın aldırın
Armorlar çok önemli :))))
Ein super Spiel wirklich nur zu empfehlen
Por que esse jogo é nota 10?

вот и пришло моё время высказаться про эту игру. Во первых эта игра заставила научиться меня бхопить потому что я видел как другие парни это делают и мне тоже очень хотелось(теперь я это использую в cs:go). А также это хорошая пародия на майнкрафт.

Awesome single player game. 1/1 m9.
Half-Life bir, ben tekim.

Incarnez un scientifique de renommé mondiale ( à tel point que les aliens connaissent aussi votre nom, oups le spoil. ) Baladez vous dans un immense complexe scientifique, élucidez des casses têtes à tour de rôle, tuez vos collègues si l'envie vous prends, exterminez des races d'aliens, bref joussif et excellent pour les nerfs, un must have pour les fans de la saga Half-Life.

Still as fun as first time i played it.

Half-Life back in the day was my first story driven action game, my personal favorite, game which started one of the most popular game series, has arena shooter feeling because game can be quite fast paced, fantastic level design and enemies.

10 out of 10, nostalgia + non stop action, this is where all started.
well :)
Einfach nur genail mehr brauch man nicht sagen
For a game thats 17+ years old is still a classic AAA game thats stands tide of time, can beat modern games today out of water, its full of variety for the fun get from its enjoyable gameplay...
mega recomendado

I got drawn into this game and played it for about 7 hours straight when first starting. Just to let you know how much I liked it - I started playing around 10 pm and didn't realize it was already 5:30 am until I saw sunlight shining through my window, and I'm one to go to bed early (like 10 pm).

I'm currently around 14 hours in, and I thought I was almost done with the game. Nope. I looked at the Chapters and I'm not even halfway through it! Well worth the few bucks I paid for it! I basically bought it because I've heard a lot about HL2 and the anticipation fans have for HL3, so I booted up my 360 and inserted The Orange Box disc only to realize it just has HL2 and a few expansions(?), not HL1. And it was another good game to ease me into using mouse and keyboard instead of a controller like I've been doing for the past 25 years.

[h1]Half-Life[/h1]
Half-Life даже сейчас, проходится с интересом. Правда, лично у меня, этот интерес разгорелся лишь к середине игры, поскольку первые уровни мне показались уж слишком скучными. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=714131489
Были моменты с получасовыми затупами, были моменты, когда проверять каждый угол, в силу незнания игры, надоедало и дальнейшее прохождение откладывалось на последующие дни. После установки русификации диалогов, стало чуточку интереснее и проще (я хотя бы понимал, что нужно делать дальше, а не слепо шел в следующую локацию и жулькал все подряд, как это было на первых этапах).
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=717006925
Большинство оружия, хранившегося у меня в инвентаре, я начал расходовать лишь к концу игры, поскольку меня постоянно преследовала мысль о том, что оно пригодится потом - как оказалось, можно было тратить все и вся на протяжении всей игры - боезапас всегда в избытке.
Я проходил Half-Life первый раз и ушло у меня на нее приблизительно 12 часов. Думаю, в среднем, геймплейного времени, от 10 до 15 часов (при первом опыте).
Серьезных багов я практически не встретил (лишь пару раз, на последних уровнях), незначительных (по типу застрявания в текстуре при автосохранении), чуть чаще.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=717007376
В общем, для игры 18-ти летней давности - весьма неплохо. Я рад, что познакомился с ней, пусть даже спустя столько лет.
it's a damn awesome game, if you don't play HL series you played nothing lol
